732505f-a.title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Refreshments - Soft drinks.
732505f-a.text:
Boy peddlers carting cold soft drinks about, in the hope of selling to
thirsty shoppers along 115th Street and First Ave.
July 16, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

731625f-b.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
731625f-b.text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Votive candles on sale at 409-413 East 115th Street, north side, east of First Avenue,
on the eve of the Feast.
July 15, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Votive candles and images on sale on East 115th Street, on
the eve of the Feast.
July 15, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Detail of another display on East 115th Streot. The giant candle on the left is probably fully six feet tall. Among the votive offerings may be seen a chest, an abdomen, two pairs of hands and an arm, and a pair of feet. In the center is a statuette of Our Lady, crowned, bearing a crowned Child
on her left arm.
July 15, 1930.
Sperr.

732434f-a.title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Fruit.
732434f-a.text:
(1)
The watermelon season is wel appreciated in New York City.
August 30, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Watermelons for sale. The lad in the foreground, is selling
hopping tage.
August 2, 1939.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Another watermelon vendor, at First Ave., and 115th Street.
July 16, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
